alert.note: Alert for West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada; Western Plumas County, Lassen Park (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 14 at 2:07PM PST until January 16 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible into Monday. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 3 feet are possible. Winds could gust as high as 70 mph at times. * WHERE...Western Plumas County/Lassen Park and West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada including Interstate 80 over Donner Pass, Highway 50 over Echo Summit and Highway 88 over Carson Pass. * WHEN...Now until 10 PM PST Monday. Heaviest snow expected into tonight with additional snow into Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heavy snow expected into tonight and with more snow continuing into Monday. Snow levels are around 5000 feet today falling tonight into Sunday to 3500-4000 feet.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada; Western Plumas County, Lassen Park
